title: Which president lived longer after being assassinated? - Quora

Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Here you go: John F. Kennedy was shot in the head at 12:30 pm, and died almost instantly. Abraham Lincoln was shot in the head around 10:30 pm at Ford’s Theater on Friday, April 14, 1865. He was unconscious. At one point his body was carried across the street to a rooming house. He died at 7:22 am the following morning, having never regained consciousness. William McKinley was shot twice in the stomach at 4:07 pm on September 6, 1901. He lingered for several days, finally succumbing to his wounds and gangrene at 12:15 am on September 14, 1901, about eight days later. James Garfield was shot twice in the back at 9:30 am on July 2, 1881. His main wound were not fatal, and had the doctors simply left alone, he would have recovered and been back in office within a few weeks. Unfortunately, American medicine was in a sorry state at that time. Despite the fact that germ theory well known in Europe, and European physicians had adopted effective sterilization procedures, American doctors, through a combination of ignorance and arrogance, refused to adopt those practices and that knowledge. As a result, Garfield lingered for close to 80 days, finally dying, after spending weeks in agonizing pain, of sepsis (blood poisoning) on September 19, 1881.
Naturally you don’t live after being assassinated.I’m guessing you mean which President lived the longest after being shot.James Garfield lived for 11 weeks after being shot.
